item.title: Beogram 4002 DC Motor Restoration: Repair of a Damaged Pickup Coil and Oil Infusion
item.description:
A Beogram 4002 DC platter motor from Australia was sent in for repair. The owner reported the motor always ran at high speed, suggesting a broken RPM feedback coil. Without this feedback, the motor receives maximum power and spins as fast as possible. Disassembly revealed the motor’s brushes were improperly installed and a solder burn marked one terminal. The small pickup coils, responsible for sending an AC voltage proportional to motor RPM, were also examined...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-dc-motor-restoration-repair-of-a-damaged-pickup-coil-and-oil-infusion/
